action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
X X X X X
X X X X ▢
X X X ▢ ▢
X X ▢ ▢ ▢
X ▢ ▢ ▢ ▢

DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid with Xs filling the top left triangle, and empty squares (▢) forming a diagonal from the bottom right to the top right, increasing by one empty square per row from bottom to top.

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
X X X X X
▢ X X X X
▢ ▢ X X X
▢ ▢ ▢ X X
▢ ▢ ▢ ▢ X
DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid with Xs forming a diagonal from the top left to the bottom right, filling all cells above and including the diagonal with Xs, and the rest with blank squares.

This is my DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid with Xs filling the top left triangle, and empty squares (▢) forming a diagonal from the bottom right to the top right, increasing by one empty square per row from bottom to top.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: In your grid, is the very first cell in the top left corner (row 1, column 1) an X or an empty square (▢)?

This is my DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid with Xs forming a diagonal from the top left to the bottom right, filling all cells above and including the diagonal with Xs, and the rest with blank squares.
QUESTION: In your grid, is the very first cell in the top left corner (row 1, column 1) an X or an empty square (▢)? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: In your grid, is the very last cell in the bottom right corner (row 5, column 5) an X or an empty square (▢)?

ANSWER: X
QUESTION: In your grid, is the very last cell in the bottom right corner (row 5, column 5) an X or an empty square (▢)? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: In your grid, does every row contain exactly one more empty square (▢) than the row above it, starting from the top row?

ANSWER: X
QUESTION: In your grid, does every row contain exactly one more empty square (▢) than the row above it, starting from the top row? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: In your grid, is the entire bottom row filled with Xs?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: In your grid, is the entire bottom row filled with Xs? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: In your grid, are all the empty squares (▢) aligned along the diagonal from the bottom left to the top right?

ANSWER: No
QUESTION: In your grid, are all the empty squares (▢) aligned along the diagonal from the bottom left to the top right? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: In your grid, does the number of Xs decrease by one in each subsequent row from top to bottom?

ANSWER: No
QUESTION: In your grid, does the number of Xs decrease by one in each subsequent row from top to bottom? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your grid and the other grid described the same?  Write "DECISION: same grid" if you think they are the same grid or "DECISION: different grids" if you think they are different grids. Do not add anything else.
